docs.snippet: The mayor of Paris is passionate about keeping the city moving....
docs.lead_paragraph: Political autobiography has long been a fine art in France. But Bertrand Delanoë, the mayor of Paris and the country's best-known gay politician, has infused his new memoir with an intimacy rare in French public life. In ''Life, Passionately,'' published last month, the 54-year-old Socialist defends his decision to announce his homosexuality six years ago, and reveals something else as well: a love affair with Paris that began as a child growing up in Tunisia.
docs.abstract: What's Doing In column on events, sightseeing, lodging, restaurants and shopping in Paris; photos; map; chart (M)

docs.snippet: In 1987, Thailand will celebrate its biggest royal festival year in more than half a century of constitutional monarchy. On Dec. 5, King Bhumibol Adulyadej, who has reigned since 1950, will reach his 60th birthday. Events will be nationwide, begin...
docs.lead_paragraph: In 1987, Thailand will celebrate its biggest royal festival year in more than half a century of constitutional monarchy. On Dec. 5, King Bhumibol Adulyadej, who has reigned since 1950, will reach his 60th birthday. Events will be nationwide, beginning Oct. 16 with a royal barge procession on Bangkok's Chao Phraya River. These magnificent slender boats, built to transport royalty in a country of rivers and canals, are now seldom seen outside their storage wharf. But they have been refurbished for this event. The Tourism Authority of Thailand plans to erect viewing stands at four points along the Chao Phraya, and will sell seats at about $11.50, on a first-come, first-served basis. Booking requests can be directed to its Marketing Development Division, Ractchadamnoen Nok Avenue, Bangkok 10100. On Dec. 3, there will be a Trooping of the Color, and on Dec. 5, the King's birthday and a national holiday, ceremonies and celebrations are planned for temples in Bangkok and beyond. From Dec. 4 to 6, three royal barges will be on view at Rajaworadit Pier.

headline.main: SEEING MORE THAN BANGKOK: A BRIEF GUIDE

docs.snippet: DONALD E. WESTLAKE is a novelist who lives in New York. His latest book, ''Kahawa,'' has just been published by Viking. By DONALD E.WESTLAKE   Ihave just returned from my third visit to Italy, and I must sit down a moment. Italy is the warehouse o...
docs.lead_paragraph: DONALD E. WESTLAKE is a novelist who lives in New York. His latest book, ''Kahawa,'' has just been published by Viking. By DONALD E.WESTLAKE Ihave just returned from my third visit to Italy, and I must sit down a moment. Italy is the warehouse of western man's history, the immediate source of our art, our law, our religion and our plumbing. The first time you travel there a great exhilaration builds, as you come to realize what a true Wonderland it is, in every possible way. Here are history and religion emblemized, simplified, dramatized, laid out before you like all the materials of a correspondence course arriving on the same day. The arts of painting and sculpture and architecture have never seemed so various and rich and self-assured. The landscape, green and yellow and warm blue, with cold blue mountaintops, is itself a panoramic painting into which, as in a children's story, you can drive in your little rented Fiat Panda. The food is not the tomato-soaked ''Italian'' of America but bounteous and varied and wonderful, as though you were a guest in the largest, most successful, best-run farmhouse on earth. You spend your days, your weeks, and you go home delighted, swearing to return.
